sections.heading: This Act shall be known as the "Mortgage Escrow Account Act".
sections.text: This Act shall be known as the "Mortgage Escrow Account Act".

sections.heading: As used in this Act, unless the context requires otherwise:
sections.text: As used in this Act, unless the context requires otherwise:

sections.heading: Escrow Accounts or escrow-like arrangements established after
sections.text:
the effective date of this Act in conjunction with mortgage agreements for
single-family owner occupied residential property are hereby declared separate
and distinct transactions from mortgages and, hence, subject to the laws
and regulations of this State.

sections.heading: On or after the effective date of this Act, each mortgage lender
sections.text:
in conjunction with the granting or servicing of a mortgage on a single-family owner
occupied residential property, shall comply with the provisions of this Act.

sections.heading: (a) When the mortgage is reduced to 65% of its original amount by
sections.text:
payments of the borrower, timely made according to the provisions of the
loan agreement secured by the mortgage, and the borrower is otherwise not
in default on the loan agreement, the mortgage lender must notify the borrower
that he may terminate such escrow account or that he may elect to continue
it until he requests a termination thereof, or until the mortgage is paid
in full, whichever occurs first.

sections.heading: In lieu of the mortgage lender establishing an escrow account
sections.text:
or an escrow-like arrangement, a borrower may pledge an interest bearing
time deposit with the mortgage lender in an
amount sufficient to secure the payment of anticipated taxes.

sections.heading: The borrower shall not have the right to terminate any such arrangement
sections.text:
under Section 5 in conjunction with mortgages insured, guaranteed, supplemented,
or assisted by the State of Illinois or the federal government that require
an escrow arrangement for their continuation. The borrower shall not have the right to terminate any such arrangement under Section 5 in conjunction with a mortgage loan that is a higher-priced mortgage loan as defined in Title 12 CFR Part 1026, as amended, unless the borrower has met all of the conditions for cancellation of an escrow account for a higher-priced mortgage loan in Title 12 CFR Part 1026, as amended.

sections.heading: If after terminating an escrow arrangement under the conditions
sections.text:
of this Act, the borrower does not furnish to the lender sufficient evidence
of payment of the taxes when due on the residence covered by the mortgage
with respect to which the escrow arrangement was established, the lender,
after taking reasonably good faith steps to verify nonpayment, may, within
thirty days after such payment is due, establish or reestablish an escrow
arrangement notwithstanding the provisions of this Act.

sections.heading: Failure of any mortgage lender operating within this State to
sections.text:
comply with the provisions of this Act shall entitle the borrower to actual
damages in a court action.

sections.heading: The provisions of this Act shall not be applicable to a mortgage
sections.text:
lender using the capitalization method of accounting for receipt of payments
for taxes. The capitalization method shall mean crediting such tax payments
directly to the loan principal upon receipt and increasing the loan balance
when the taxes are paid.

sections.heading: Notice of the requirements of the Act shall be furnished in writing
sections.text: to the borrower at the date of closing.

sections.heading: This Act takes effect on January 1, 1976.
sections.text: This Act takes effect on January 1, 1976.
